column3: Would it work to place the comment in an extra line instead, between `FILE_ENV=...` and `QEMU_USER_CMD=...`? The comment itself would still be helpful for anyone trying to understand or edit the Travis file IMHO.
No, it wouldn't: the `>` character starts the "Folded Block Scalar". The closest line to place a comment is above `env: >-`.
```suggestion\n      arch: arm64  # Can disable QEMU_USER_CMD and run the tests natively without qemu\n```
